intro: Lastrea platyptera, commonly known as the flat-leaf lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from red to orange, attracting pollinators like bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and minimal water.
